website_summaries.verdict: This shaver will give you a decent shave, but the battery life may be an issue for some users.
pros: Offers similar qualities as other Braun shavers at a fraction of the price
Provides straight stroke performance for an exceptional value
cons: Its charged battery life is about half that of more expensive models

website_summaries.verdict: This electric razor is the best model, given some of it’s stand-out qualities including its quality trimmer attachment and long-lasting battery life.
pros: Provides a close shave, even when used without shaving cream
Durable model with long-lasting battery life
Has a quality trimmer for harder-to-reach spots
Conveniently catches hair to ensure no mess in the sink
cons: Razor is a heavier model, which is something to consider for travel

customer_reviews.title: AVOID like the plague.  Dies unexpectedly.
customer_reviews.text: Avoid like the plague. Have bought three of these for myself and sons, two have died already in less than 2 years of use. I dealt with the fact that the foil heads wear out about once a year. I have no problem ponying up $25 to replace. But two of these have just died. One day they just don't turn on. The LED indicator stays lit, but nothing else happens. Both razors weren't abused and probably had 10-20 charges between them. From what I see online this isn't a rarity, happens all the time. Stay away.
customer_reviews.author: K. Burnett

customer_reviews.title: Shaver is a disappointment
customer_reviews.text: I got this shaver for my husband in December. A couple weeks ago the shaving head fell apart. I contacted them & they emailed the necessary paperwork along with a prepaid mailing label. I filled it out & returned it & they immediately called me, saying the head was not guaranteed, only the motor. I had to pay for the new head & was told it broke because my husband apparently pressed down too hard when he used it. It arrived yesterday & he shaved today & still Is not as efficient as expected. Very disappointed in this product. To top it off, this is a replacement for one our son gifted him which also broke in the same way.
customer_reviews.author: june

customer_reviews.title: Great quality and awesome shave!!
customer_reviews.text: One of the best shavers i have purchased ever! Great quality and shave is so smooth. Love that i can use it wet or dry. I have used both rotary and foil. I use the rotary on my bald head and prefer foil on my face. Rotarys get damaged much less easier than the foils, but foils are much better shave. I have tried shaving with regular razor and cream, i dont understand how anyone can waste their time doing that, along with the cost and the mess. Try it for 2 or 3 weeks, you will never go back.
customer_reviews.author: Paul Burnham

customer_reviews.title: Happy with this purchase
customer_reviews.text: Good shaver. Especially for smaller faces or with face deep features (like jawline, under the nose, etc). Works well on thin hair. Very little skin irritation (if any), even right after the shave. Wet shaving is a HUGE plus. After a few tries (to learn how you hair grow), with good quality shaving cream results are practically indistinguishable from those obtained with manual razor. Update: with experience, use of shaving cream becomes unnecessary, just splash some water on the skin. For really really flat growing hair, dry shaving helps to get better results. 1 stars taken away just for one reason - I would like to have a charging stand for this unit.
customer_reviews.author: Yury

customer_reviews.title: Cheap China junk, parts cost more than the razor!
customer_reviews.text: This Braun Electric is absolutely junk! I tried my best to get use of it but ended up it just with the same ruff and red face. I bought this razor because it was a Braun. But I now realize Braun stopped making quality . Very disappointed in the razor and the company. To top in off tried to return it, no way.
customer_reviews.author: Frank Rosano

customer_reviews.title: Thought I'[d be getting a good razor according to the reviews
customer_reviews.text: Thought I'[d be getting a good razor according to the reviews, never did get a close shave without working at it for a long time, had to move it in all ways to finally get an almost close shave. After two months the motor quit turning and the whole unit got almost too hot to touch. Won't try another Braun product again. Back to Norelco
customer_reviews.author: Brennen

customer_reviews.title: Good product for average skin and facial hair
customer_reviews.text: I bought this shaver in hopes that I could avoid razor burn. I have very sensitive skin and very curly facial har, so I have a perfect combination for a terrible shaving experience. The foil parts seem to work fine, but there’s the middle cutting part that tears up my neck. It works great when I’m shaving my face, but any other spot it a real pain(literally). Because my facial hair is so curly I’m left with a few stray hairs that decided to hug my skin. It seems like this product would work fine for the average guy with normal hair and skin, but it didn’t work for me.
customer_reviews.author: Spencer Addington

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy till you read this
customer_reviews.text: Shaves great, but there's no way to effectively clean it. You can't disassemble the head to get the crud out. I let it run under running water on a daly basis, and weekly (or more often) I soak the head in a bathroom cup with Dawn detergent, then take it in the shower to remove the shaving debris. The last Braum I had allowed the head to be dissembled. I suppose the high-the Braun units with a cleaning attachment might overcome this issue if you want to pay $150-250 for a shaver. I alternate this shaver with a Remington rotary, which is super easy to do a total cleanup.
customer_reviews.author: reader1

customer_reviews.title: Water protection is no good due to poor built quality
customer_reviews.text: See photos. The shaver was not built with good quality. This new version of 3 series had exact problem as older one. Liquid leaked into the inner compartment and corroded batteries plus motor and circuit. Only 2 screws securing the clear plastic cover when there are total of 6 mounting holes. Don't expect this shaver last long. I bought the older one in Aug 2014 and this newer version on in August 2016. Two years is about the most you can get out of this shaver.
customer_reviews.author: David Zheng

customer_reviews.title: Wow, really the best at this price
customer_reviews.text: Without a doubt this is the best darn electric shaver I’ve ever used! And I’ve had Braun’s before, and at same sort of price point. I was just beside myself with excitement with the close but more importantly quick shave it gave me. And equally thrilled every morning I use it - and I know that sounds a little over the top, but that’s actually the way I feel about this particular shaver. Also, make sure you get this model with the trimmer, even the trimmer is better than it used to be on the other models.
customer_reviews.author: todd williams

customer_reviews.title: Doesnt work
customer_reviews.text: So I bought this because I forget to shave my legs often, so I thought I'd get a decent razor to do it on the fly. Didn't cut the hair, at all. I thought maybe I had the wrong type of hair for it, or something, so I had my boyfriend try to shave his face with it (a little gross, but bear with me) and it didn't cut the hair on his face at all. The trimmer works, but the razor part is useless. I'm going to try to buy another blade to see if it could be that, but I essentially spent $60 on a body trimmer.
customer_reviews.author: Lindsey Lawless

customer_reviews.title: Painful Experience
customer_reviews.text: This razor was a waste of time and money. The heads fall out, and the screen scratches your face, and catches on facial hair, which pulls and snags on your face. I have a Braun travel razor and the screen is better and easier to use. Seems like the more expensive the Braun is, the worse the shaving screen is, shouldn't it be the other way around? I plan to return this as quickly as possible. I do like the wet/dry feature, but not at the expense of my face.
customer_reviews.author: John P

customer_reviews.title: Great shave!
customer_reviews.text: I have had Remington electrics, because they have always given me a razor-smooth shave, because they are relatively inexpensive, and they have been very durable (lasts for years and years). Decided to try a Braun, based on the reviews. This Braun is excellent! The shave is every bit as good as the Remingtons. The battery life isn't quite as long, but the battery life is still very good. Grey hairs are harder to shave, but the Braun does an excellent (better) job with them in the harder to shave areas. Very quiet, too!
customer_reviews.author: Papillion

customer_reviews.title: Not so special
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because I had an electric razor that broke on me and I thought spending more would get me a better shave. This one did not. It was actually harder to get a closer shave. However, I give this 3 stars and not a 1 star because no matter how hard i shave, i rarely get razor burns and I am prone to getting them. I think I'm going to go back to non-electric razors and actually spend my a few minutes to shave instead of hoping that my 20 second shave with an electric razor will do better.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Still made in Germany
customer_reviews.text: Was formerly using a Braun 8000 series from 2002-3. The detail trimmer stopped functioning(believe the GF dropped it), but good riddance; this works better in all ways. Lighter, easier to hold, no nicks, 100% water proof, and still made in Germany. I rinse with the head with warm water right after I shave, then I rinse with a couple squirts of 91% iso alcohol. The water doesn't get it clean alone, but a bottle of iso is about 2.50 at the Walmart/Target and will last 6 months. Dont fuss with the silly shaver base. Too much money for results that can be achieve with some 91% isopropyl.
customer_reviews.author: Scott

customer_reviews.title: Braun is the Best
customer_reviews.text: I've been using electric shavers for a long time - Remington, Norelco, Panasonic and Braun. This is my third Braun, and the best to date. Wet & Dry shavers are the only way to go, and Braun offers a wide range of models. This is one of their less expensive models, but make no mistake about it: It's powerful and yields a great shave. I'm very happy with this purchase. Whether shaving dry, or in the shower with a dab of Cremo shave cream, this shaver performs admirably. There's no need to experiment with other brands: Braun is the best.
customer_reviews.author: J. D. Fisher

customer_reviews.title: Wish I hadn't bought this
customer_reviews.text: I use this shaver to shave my head and on my throat below my beard. It does an ok job on my head which is why I gave it two stars instead of one. But I wished I had not bought this shaver for two reasons: 1) it is unable to shave the hairs on my neck even if I shave every day. It can't get close enough to take away the fine hairs. 2) it is very messy. Even though I clean it after each use, as I shave the shavings come out of the head and get all over the sink.
customer_reviews.author: bookeditions

customer_reviews.title: TYPICAL SHAVER
customer_reviews.text: Over the years I've owned probably 10-15 electric shavers. They are all just about the same. None of them give you a really good shave, all of them leave stubble on your face. Just a good enough shave to be presentable but not good enough to leave you totally satisfied. The only really good shave is with a blade but since I have to take a blood thinner, can't risk a nick or cut, which happens often with a blade. Just have to be somewhat satisfied with what i have and have been using.
customer_reviews.author: WHITECAPS

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing after all the hype.
customer_reviews.text: I have always used Norelco 3 head shavers and got many years of close shaves from them. I thought I would try a Braun to see how it compares. I am very disappointed in this unit. After a few months of use I have found that it shoots shavings out of the head and is as dull as a butter knife. I found myself pressing it against my face to get it to get a generally close shave. My advice is to either use a blade or go with a Norelco (Phillips) shaver.
customer_reviews.author: Memorabilia_man

customer_reviews.title: Less cutting power than the Braun Razor it replaces. Not for you if you have a heavy beard.
customer_reviews.text: This razor has less cutting power than the Braun Razor it replaces. If you have a heavy beard it takes a very long time to shave. A major problem is that the razor will not work with the cord attached. The voltage provided by the charger is higher than that provided by the battery, so on all my prior Braun Razors, I would use them with the cord attached in order to get more cutting power out of them. This razor is designed to prevent you from doing that, with the consequence that it takes me much longer to shave with one of these. The razor tends to stall while cutting.
customer_reviews.author: Maneki Neko

customer_reviews.title: Braun 3 series
customer_reviews.text: This is a well made shaver and does a pretty good job, but I did return. I highly recommend you at least step up to the 5 series to get the more powerful motor. Braun just released the 8 series shaver for 2019. It too has the more powerful motor, the head is similar to the 5 series and it has the upgraded display of the 9 series. I also recommend getting the 5 series or above with the cleaning station. It charges you shaver, gives you a place to safely store it, cleans the shaver and lubricates it to keep it in peak running shape.
customer_reviews.author: TRUMP 2020

customer_reviews.title: Baby shaver
customer_reviews.text: I'm the type of guy who needs a week to grow something resembling a 5 o'clock shadow beard. Alas, this shaver is just useless. It can barely shave the few hairs that do grow from day to day. As another reviewer noted, it can barely shave the armpits of a baby. It's really that bad. It would take you 30 minutes to shave your face with this thing. It has absolutely no traction. You might as well use a razor blade or another shaver to do it in 5 minutes. Waste of time. I returned it right away. Appreciated the opportunity to try it though.
customer_reviews.author: Andre

customer_reviews.title: Superfluous cleaner and case
customer_reviews.text: My second Braun. Works fine. I find that the cleaner and case do not add any value —- just increase the cost. It also does not have a cutter cover so I am concerned that the cutter will be damaged in my shaving kit. Where do I get a cover like I had for my last Braun?
customer_reviews.author: bopeep

customer_reviews.title: The best shaving machine in this world.
customer_reviews.text: Is a wonderful product. My skin is real sensitive. When I used to shave I always got cut. Know no anymore. Thanks for selling this type of shaving machine. 👍
customer_reviews.author: RONALD J. BRADEN

customer_reviews.title: So far so good ...
customer_reviews.text: So far, so good. It gives me a fast and close and comfortable shave -- closer than any electric razor I have owned in the past. It is also fairly quiet. It shaves the finer hairs on my neck near the edge of my beard (and on the back of my neck) that my previous electric razor could not. The heaviest parts of my beard require two or three passes. I have not yet used it for wet shaving (shaving with water and electricity would totally freak out my wife!). I have not owned it long enough to evaluate the battery life, but I have gotten multiple shaves from a single charge.
customer_reviews.author: Jackson MS Consumer

customer_reviews.title: Not a very close shave.
customer_reviews.text: I have always loved Braun products because of their design, from the early days of Dieter Rams, to their longevity. For example, I am only my second electric toothbrush. The first one lasted over 20 years. This is the first electric razor i have purchased so perhaps i was expecting too much. But the shave is not close at all, even after two or three passes. I returned this and will stick with my single blade razor.
customer_reviews.author: Steve Racz

customer_reviews.title: Works well for the cost
customer_reviews.text: This shaver works well and gives a decent shave for the cost of the shaver. It lasts just over a week on a full charge but the only thing is that I never get the three green lights after a charge but only two. I do not know if that affects the length of how long it stays charged or not as in the manual it says it should light up all three green lights. I had a panasonic shaver before this and it eventually would not hold a charge after about a year and a half so I will see if this one is better or not.
customer_reviews.author: JRG

customer_reviews.title: Purchased for my father. He is older with a light beard. Loves it.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my dad and for him, it is perfect. He gets a decent shave, and uses it every other morning. Occasionally he still shaves with a blade, but he is overwhelmingly pleased. I take care of the cleaning and it cleans easily. He uses it dry with electric shave. I haven’t ever tried it wet. For his purposes, it is excellent. I have a heavy beard and would have different results. I shave with a double edge safety razor. Nothing else works for me. But this razor is the right match for my father.
customer_reviews.author: SK

customer_reviews.title: Main Feature Abysmally Useless
customer_reviews.text: Day One: Used the trimmer to pre-shave the longer hair. Dry shave yielded scattershot results so I tried again after a shower to not much better results. Patches of stubble, bumps, and forcing the razor HARD across my face left said patches right in their same location untouched. Day Two: Un-boxed it before deciding to return and thought I'd give it a second chance. Showered, dried off, and applied shaving cream to my face this time. Same scattershot results. Patches of stubble, far removed from the definition of a close or smooth shave. The trimmer is, well, a trimmer so it is the only reason I say they deserve one star instead of zero.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher Williams

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Shaver
customer_reviews.text: I have been using this shaver for over a week now. It is far superior to the Norelco shaver I had been using. It cuts much closer, much easier, with far fewer needs to re-shave areas. So far it hasn't nipped me or burned me. The first charging of the battery was more than enough for a weeks usage. I use it dry - no reason to mess around with shaving cream, unlike the Norelco. This makes cleaning it extremely easy. I expect to be a Braun customer for many more years.
customer_reviews.author: Vaughn Hopkins

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: Awful Shaver - the worst I ever had - missed a ton of hairs, my wife reminded me constantly...
customer_reviews.author: Karen

customer_reviews.title: Smooth, Close and Quiet Shave
customer_reviews.text: Great product by Braun yet again. It has a smooth shave (do not press too hard onto your face or you may hurt the skin surface and get blemishes). I have always had Braun products and think they are some of the best in the world. They also do not need to cost the earth and this electric razor is a prime example. Shaves close and shaves strong but without the high pitched sound of the series 7. I can't believe I used to wake up and shave with the Series 7 jet engine on my face, but hey I was a lot younger then and thought that louder was stronger - not any longer.
customer_reviews.author: TimeBandit

customer_reviews.title: Have to have.
customer_reviews.text: Just tried it today and it did a great job on my head and face. Not sure if I'm supposed to take the clippings out before recharging since it's supposed to clean itself but did it anyhow. Anyhow it did do an awesome job but it did not do it as the page said in one swipe. One thing I did notice though is how close the shave was wich surprised me. I bought it while it was on discount for $60 but it's definitely worth the unit price.
customer_reviews.author: Vicente Clark

customer_reviews.title: Gets The Job Done
customer_reviews.text: I'm not a very hairy guy, but I do need to shave. This double blade razor is perfect for me. Doesn't cut too deep or cause ingrowns, which is exactly what I was looking for. This is my second razor of this model. On the first one, the pop up sideburn trimmer broke after 5 years, which rendered the razor nearly useless to me. I had no desire to have two different razors to trim up with. So, I somewhat reluctantly bought a second one of the same model because I like how it shaves. Guess we'll see how long the second one lasts! Recommend overall.
customer_reviews.author: michael price

customer_reviews.title: Good, reliable cordless shaver
customer_reviews.text: This is a replacement for my older Braun of the equivalent model. I liked it, but its batteries were getting tired after 5 years. So I got this similar model. It's even better than the old one, with a number of incremental improvements: battery life a bit longer; quieter; shaves reliably a bit closer. I'm very pleased with this new shaver. One minus: the new one came with no charging stand, just a charger with a cord. But luckily, the electrical connector is the same as the old one, so the new shaver sits just the same on the old one's charging stand. Nice catch.
customer_reviews.author: Douglas Dodds

customer_reviews.title: Second razor in 2 days that failed to run
customer_reviews.text: Used this razor brand / model before. Kept 2 on had, one used at home and one for travel. The home use razor failed after about year and I ordered a replacement, which failed in less that a day. Ordered a replacement, and returned to failure. Replacement within a day of delivery. After ruling out electric problems at home, I decided that Quality control of the the product was problematic and decided to purchase from a local store, which did not have a Braun razor in stock. So I bought a Remington, which operates reliably , but is not easy to use as the Braun. Two failure is 3 days in just not acceptable.
customer_reviews.author: None

customer_reviews.title: CHARGER NOT INCLUDED!.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this as a Christmas present. Imaging my surprise to find out it DID NOT COME WITH A CHARGER. The product picture (1st pic) shows a charger is included so I didn't even think to check for one when the package came. Got a call today that the giftee went to charge the shaver but the charger was "missing" from the box. Went to their house to check it out, and per the box (2nd pic) it does not include a charger, just the other three items, so it is a useless item. Since I have already thrown away the package it came in and the paperwork guess I am out of luck on requesting a refund. Major lesson learned.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Light, durable and provides a clean shave
customer_reviews.text: This is my third Braun shaver, and I'm as satisfied as I was with the others before. Each one has lasted me about 8 years (with new blades every 2 years), and this new one seems to be just as high quality. The shave is very close. The battery charge lasts almost two weeks before charging. Cleaning it is super easy, just rinse under running water. I'm very happy with this Braun shaver! Great German quality!
customer_reviews.author: Michael Beck

customer_reviews.title: The BEST deal...
customer_reviews.text: Great product from BRAUN as usual. Bought this model instead of the 3080s, because it was $30 cheaper. It doesn't have the base charging stand, but I was able to use my old base charging stand as the connections are all the same, so saved the extra $30, perfect! Also the 3080s doe's not have a trimmer, cannot figure out why it is more expensive, with less functions? Go figure....
customer_reviews.author: Jerry

customer_reviews.title: It works as advertised.
customer_reviews.text: I should come with a snap on blade cover. I put it back in the accessory (extra purchase) travel case when it's done cleaning, but I'd rather it had it's own shield. There is NOWHERE, that I can find, that explains the meaning of the multiple lights that are on the razor and put on a minor light show as cleaning continues. The clean cycle takes hours, so don't expect to share unless two of you have day and night schedules. I bought this one to replace the one that broke when it dropped from counter height. I don't expect this one to fair any better. Happy, not ecstatic.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed with this newer model 3040s
customer_reviews.text: I gave it 3 stars due to poor closeness of shave. I got a poor quality shaving head this time. I recently purchased the Braun 3040s to replace my almost identical but aging 340s model. The old 340s still worked but wasn’t holding a charge for more than 2-3 days. Quite understandable as it is 7-8 years old. I finally swapped the head off the old unit to get a better shave. I hope replacing the head will resolve this but they are so expensive. I’ve been pleased with Braun for 25+ years and hope this is a fluke.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good shaves,trimmer and excellent battery life
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a replacement to an older Braun I had for many years. It's a great value for the money especially with the included trimmer, a must have for my mustache. I have gone almost 2 weeks between battery charges for a typical daily shave. It doesn't include a carry case but the included plastic shield is good enough for packing this in your luggage without worrying about damage to the shaver screen or it being turned on by mistake.
customer_reviews.author: Ioannis K. Moutsatsos

customer_reviews.title: Can't be beat at any price
customer_reviews.text: Not my first Braun shaver and sure won't be my last one. Had the old one I don't even know how many years. Started making funny noises so knew it was time for a new one. They are just a quality product and I feel a bargain. I've used many different brands over the years and the Braun units are easily the best. And they are the "only" electric razors I've used with a head that just doesn't wear out, it just gets dull, eventually.
customer_reviews.author: Daryl Growcock

customer_reviews.title: Was a supported of these Shavers, but they have gone downhill
customer_reviews.text: I have brought a string of these Braun Shavers, but will consider another product for my next purchase. Basically the Cutter-Block is moved back-and-forth by some small plastic nibs that rest on small metal spikes at the top of the main shaver body. These tend to wear rapidly and break making the shaver useless. There is no way to replace them or fix them. This must be the Braun strategy for planned obsolescence. I can get no more than about 7 months of use out of one shaver.
customer_reviews.author: Cswami

customer_reviews.title: I Recommend
customer_reviews.text: Used this for a few months and am happy with it. It doesn't get as close as a shaver on the first pass like a straight blade but works to not irritate my skin even with a few passes over. I perfer this over straight blades now as my skin is still smooth as after using and doesn't get itchy or bumpy afterwards. Compact and great for traveling.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah

customer_reviews.title: What was promised
customer_reviews.text: The shaver works better than any of the others that I have tried. A dry shaver without the mess and clean up time. I dont like the idea of cutting the skin when we have a so called pandemic in the world. For the travelling man its the best plan to get a close shave every morning or even before the day is over if needed. Other razors simply would not last and made cleaning too much of a hassle. Good product over all.
customer_reviews.author: tradesman

customer_reviews.title: Never Worked - Very Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my 15 year old son, as a birthday present. It was supposed to be his first razor. The look and feel of this razor is impressive and comfortable to hold. I didn't know it was broken because by the time he said anything, it was too late to return. He doesn't have a lot of facial hair and it was summer, so he didn't try to use it very often. The main razor piece does not cut anything. If you take the blades off and turn it on, it vibrates, but I don't think it is strong enough for the blades to cut. He has been using the trim piece to shave his entire face.
customer_reviews.author: LoriNico

customer_reviews.title: Good value
customer_reviews.text: This was a gift for an elderly parent. It’s easy for him to use, he likes the results and the battery lasts a week of use. The down side is it’s difficult for him to p,ug in himself to charge and doesn’t operate while plugged in.
customer_reviews.author: Paula O'Kelly

customer_reviews.title: Not happy
customer_reviews.text: For years I have used Norelco triple head electric razors, but when my last one quit before it was a year old I decided to try a Braun. This razor takes a lot longer to shave with than the Norelco and if you don't shave every day it doesn't work at all. The pop up trimmer is awkward to use. It does appear to be well made and would probably last a long time, but if you don't get a good shave, what good is that?
customer_reviews.author: Robert E Regelmann

customer_reviews.title: Can’t get neck
customer_reviews.text: The constant pulling of hairs was annoying but the biggest problem from the get go was that I could never get all my neck hairs. I would go over an area over and over in different directions but I always had straggly hairs left over. I’m going back to a cartridge razor. I liked the convenience but it doesn’t outweigh the cons for me.
customer_reviews.author: Dan S.

customer_reviews.title: Braun Cutting Corners
customer_reviews.text: Braun is cutting corners. Braun no longer includes a hard case or blade oil. Another issue is charging. With my previous Braun shaver, when the battery died, you could plug it in and shave while it's recharging. Not with this one. The razor will not operate when plugged in like the older models. The razor must be charged prior to use. On the positive side, it provides a very close shave. It's not as smooth as a safety razor used with a three pass process but it is much quicker and almost as smooth.
customer_reviews.author: Martin R.

customer_reviews.title: Great shave and great battery!
customer_reviews.text: Great shave! Have been a Braun user for many years. Last one was 15 yr old, getting noisy, would not hold a charge and ready for head replacement. Refused to invest more into old shaver. So glad I sprang for a new Braun! Great shave, close and no burning or nicks. Quiet! Hardly makes more than a humming noise. Trimmer works way better than my old shaver, and I thought the old one was doing a decent job. The battery life is remarkable! Got 18 shaves before red light came on. Recharged very quickly. I would recommend this shaver to anyone interested in a new electric shaver.
customer_reviews.author: rjbdeals

customer_reviews.title: It looked nice..But Came with missing parts.
customer_reviews.text: It might be a great shaver, but I will never know. I ordered a NEW one and it came in a returned condition. Parts missing and looked like it had been already used. The good side of this is I returned it next day and there were no issues in getting a refund.
customer_reviews.author: NR

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the money (at all)
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointed in this shaver. It just doesn't give a close shave at all - surprising for the cost vs. much cheaper razors I have had in the past. In addition, the pop up trimmer is basically useless (can't line up anything). Like the main shaver itself, it just doesn't cut. Find a better, more affordable razor - there are many out there. I'd like to return this but my amazon window for returns closed, so now it's a $70 paperweight. Booo.
customer_reviews.author: Spladao

customer_reviews.title: Terrible product, doesn’t give a close shave
customer_reviews.text: I’m not impressed whatsoever, this razor does not give you a close shave at all. I’ve tried everything and it’s just not giving me anywhere near a shave that I would expect from Braun as a whole. I’m a long time user of brain products and this one fell short by a mile
customer_reviews.author: Desert Snow

customer_reviews.title: Nice Razor
customer_reviews.text: It works as advertised and shaves well. I was just surprised that it flashes it light at me to recharge it after every shave, regardless of how long I spent shaving. I guess it doesn't really matter since I have the cord plugged in and ready to go whenever it wants more 'juice'.
customer_reviews.author: Kenneth Green

customer_reviews.title: It converted me
customer_reviews.text: I had previous not-so-good experiences with electric shavers that forced myself for years to shave manually. I decided to give this one a try after reading some positive review and articles about it. It works well, it's gentle on my skin and easy to clean. I admit that sometimes if insist too much shaving leftover hairs on my neck it gets my skin slightly irritated, but most of the times I get a perfect shave.
customer_reviews.author: DobroReader

customer_reviews.title: Best Electric Razor I've Tried
customer_reviews.text: I have had 3 Brauns through the years, along with Remingtons, and one terrible rotary. This is the best one yet. I usually try to stay under $100, but in this price range I have seen them move from a really useful pop-up trimmer, to a useless one, and back to a useful one in this model. In addition, the waterproofing is new to me and makes thorough cleaning a breeze; plus, I can shave in the shower and not spray whiskers all over the counter. The triple blade system also does a nice job of getting longer hairs and attacking the thicker growth areas without have to do a lot of extra passes. I would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: MysteryShopper

customer_reviews.title: So far we are very pleased with the shave. Hope it lasts!
customer_reviews.text: We purchased this to replace our Norelco Body groomer, since we were tired of buying a new one every two years and having to exercise the warranty in between each time. So far we are very pleased with this new shaver. It leaves your skin so much smoother than the Norelco with no 'nips' at you like the Norelco would do. As long as we can get a couple of years out of this with no issues, then we will be Braun buyers from now on.
customer_reviews.author: Ann Freeman

customer_reviews.title: Works well, needs accessories
customer_reviews.text: I have owned several Braun shavers, and they never disappoint. Unlike the other Braun shavers, this one does not come with a travel case or cleaning brush. I have the brush from my previous shaver, but the Series 3 does not fit the old case. This will make travel with the shaver inconvenient, as it may discharge in my suitcase.
customer_reviews.author: BT

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product!
customer_reviews.text: After a decade shaving with another razor, the Braun 5, needed anew shaver and after testing two others, decided on getting this one. I was surprised at the battery duration (a week), the close shaving and the excellent trimmer with many other shavers lack. Excellent product and highly recommended especially for its price.
customer_reviews.author: M in Florida

customer_reviews.title: too hot for his face
customer_reviews.text: husband loves everything about this razor except that it heats up so quickly that it's too hot for his face & he can't finish shaving. This is a replacement for the same razor from Braun that we hoped was just a bad razor & not typical. 2 razors 2 hot & we aren't gonna try again
customer_reviews.author: BookshireCrone

customer_reviews.title: Great shaver!
customer_reviews.text: At first I wasn't getting the shave I was expecting (since I watched the video about how great this shaver was). But it turned out to work just as fast of my last amazing Braun shaver, so I love it just as much. I love it's slightly bulky, quality construction. The battery lasts about 30-40 mins. It fully charges in 4 hours, which beats the 9 hour charge from my previous shaver. The trimmer on the side works well, too.
customer_reviews.author: Rob

customer_reviews.title: Very good electric shaver
customer_reviews.text: I prefer wet shaving for closeness, but when I'm in a hurry, this shaver does a darn good job. I typically use it dry and about 10 or more minutes after washing my face. I would recommend this shaver. Keep it perpendicular to your face when using it and take your take your time.
customer_reviews.author: Trumpeter64

customer_reviews.title: Nice shape, lousy shave
customer_reviews.text: Good looking shaver. Unfortunately it gives a lousy shave. It simply won’t pick up and cut longer whiskers as compared to my 12 year old Remington shaver. The pop up trimmer teeth are so short and small that they’re worthless trying to trim sideburns. I’ve cleaned it, oiled it, nothing helps. I look like I used a dull knife to shave with.
customer_reviews.author: TimK

customer_reviews.title: Not very robust for daily usage...
customer_reviews.text: The foil just seems so fragile and it’s really hard to clean the tiny spaces with the lousy brush. So that leads to buildup which impacts performance efficiency. The razor generally gives a decent cut but every day (literally) it seems to be trying harder to compensate for the clogged pinholes in the foil. That being said I’m looking beyond Braun for my next razor.
customer_reviews.author: BMBell2929

customer_reviews.title: Best razor money can buy
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this after reading several reviews. I had been using Remington Micro Screen series shavers because they delivered the closet shave. So, I was expecting to be disappointed. I am glad to say that I am absolutely delighted that I purchased the Braun Series 3 ProSkin 3040s Men's Electric Razor. It shaves even closer than the Remington MS series foils and I didn't think that was possible. I also have a Panasonic Arc3 that I like, but it never shaved close enough for me. Don't hesitate to purchase this electric shaver. You will not be disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent shaver, but lifespan is so-so
customer_reviews.text: Very happy with the quality of the shave and the features of the shaver. I have a tough beard and this shaver handles it no problem, without irritating my skin. The negative is that it died after 2.5 years. Basically the batteries stopped taking a charge. I'm happy enough with it though that I'm going to order another one.
customer_reviews.author: Andy

customer_reviews.title: I would definitely recommend...
customer_reviews.text: After being faithful to Remington shavers for 10 years, I decided to try Braun based on a great product line and above average consumer reviews. So far I am pleased with the type of shave the Series 3 provides. It maneuvers smoothly across the face and neck to provide an accurate cover. The battery life is great to shave 2-3 times weekly with a single charge, I am sure the charge will hold much longer, however I like to keep mines plugged-in. If your battleing the choice of shavers, the Braun Series 3 is worth the try. Also I found Amazon to be the cheapest compared to other online retail stores.
customer_reviews.author: ADRIEL M.

customer_reviews.title: Painful shave with little results
customer_reviews.text: This thing seems to pull hair out instead of cutting. You have to press extremely hard on your face to get any kind of progress. No matter how hard you press and how many times you go over the same area, you will still need to get out the Mach 3 and do it right. Painful time waster.
customer_reviews.author: GT

customer_reviews.title: Won't work if it's plugged into outlet
customer_reviews.text: Annoying! The only outlet in my bathroom is switched (only active if lights are on). So, I planned to use this as a corded. Plus, when the batteries stop holding a charge (and they all will), you can still use it until you get a replacement. But, they put in circuitry to make it not work if it's plugged in. The only upside is they included instructions on how to remove the batteries (for recycling)--that means I might be able to replace them.
customer_reviews.author: Jim

customer_reviews.title: I couldn't be happier with this shaver
customer_reviews.text: I couldn't be happier with this shaver. I've tried electric razors a few times over the years, and always went back to blades due to the poor shave. This one gets 95% of all the hair, and the trimmer is great. The trimmer extends farthe than others and gives a great trim anywhere you need. I now shave every day for the first time in years, and feel better about myself thanks to this affordable razor. By the way the battery lasts for several shaves.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: misses a lot
customer_reviews.text: I never removed my beard so I use it to shave my neck. I have had two surgeries in my neck in front and it is no longer smooth. I have to go over the same area several times to get most hair. Even using a safety razor at times. Not my first Braun, expected better. The battery does hold a charge long.
customer_reviews.author: D.L.M.

customer_reviews.title: Good value
customer_reviews.text: Purchased for my father who uses it daily to shave his face and head. He said it works great. Foil heads need to be replaced every so often but he said this brand works the best for him so far. He has to replace them every two years or so but feels he gets value for the amount of use.
customer_reviews.author: Jaime O.

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable!
customer_reviews.text: Boyfriend used my electric razor for a while for his face and I found this for him. His first thoughts was "It's wayy better than yours" and "I like how this looks." It was easy to utilize the tools it comes with including the side burn/mustache trimmer. No pulling, no cuts, completely safe.
customer_reviews.author: Vicky

customer_reviews.title: Bad Battery
customer_reviews.text: Worked okay for a week, then battery failed - would not fully, or hold, charge. When working well, it eventually would complete the shave of my wire brush like beard, but would struggle somewhat. Not the best for my situation - returned and exchanged for a higher end shaver from a different company.
customer_reviews.author: FLebel

customer_reviews.title: Braun Series 3 ProSkin 3040s Wet&Dry Shaver: Works well for my light to medium shaving needs.
customer_reviews.text: This Braun Series 3 ProSkin 3040s Wet&Dry Shaver is my Second such Braun model replacement over the past several years. Works well for my light to medium shaving needs. Easy on sensitive skin. It does require numerous passes to shave me close so heavily bearded customers may find it inefficient. SA mentioned, I've a ordered a couple of these and even replaced the cutter blocks over the past several years. I am pleased with this product.
customer_reviews.author: Dave K.

customer_reviews.title: Works well
customer_reviews.text: I seen some complainants about it rusting i dont bring it in the shower myself after shower i foam up and use it works well i try not to over load with water wet shave is a much better shave than dry but wet or dry still just fine for me
customer_reviews.author: Frank R

customer_reviews.title: Wierd Shaver
customer_reviews.text: I say think twice before you purchase this one -- do pay attention to what many reviews say, if you shave every day and have a light bread -- great shaver for the money if not you will be kicking yourself every time you try to use it. Suggest you move over to a Remington in the same price range If fall into the category of a heavy bread or long hair ---- replacement parts may be priced higher than Braun but don't let that put you off.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas James

customer_reviews.title: Best razor for the bucks - for me
customer_reviews.text: I have been using a rotary norelco for the last few years to try something new and most importantly- something quieter. I was using Brauns for years but didn’t like the noise. This new Braun is extremely good- shaves very close and is much more quiet and solid feeling than the older ones I was using. Just a subtle hum and won’t wake up the family. $59 vs $279? You decide but I think it performs just as good as the more expensive ones.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very powerful
customer_reviews.text: I have tried many electric razors. This one is the only one I can use when shaving my head and feel as if it shaved close. It is easy to clean up and the blade has lasted much longer than the manufacturer has indicated in the description. I still need to use a razor if I want that shine without buffing look 2 years later, but at 3 shaves a week it cuts smooth still.
customer_reviews.author: rockne flugan

customer_reviews.title: Works good on course hair.
customer_reviews.text: Not impressed with the overall closeness of the shave. Might just be that this isn't intended for ladies finer leg hair? Granted a razor is undoubtedly a closer shave but expected a little better cut.
customer_reviews.author: Tammy

customer_reviews.title: Beware not good
customer_reviews.text: Bought this shaver to replace my father’s current Braun shaver. This one stopped working after few weeks. It was a father’s day gift. I’m really disappointed and the return window has closed I’m out of the cost of shaver. I should bought a shaver at Costco . It’s completely dead will not charge light up or anything
customer_reviews.author: Chine Castro

customer_reviews.title: Slow and inconsistent shave.
customer_reviews.text: I bought it so I can save time over regular razor. Unfortunately, results are very inconsistent, and sometimes random hairs or areas are left uncut (2-3 day growth). In practice, I need to shave twice. Getting a clean shave with it takes a long time, much longer than a regular razor. I also get minor cuts, and my skin gets irritated. I thought it will work better after me and my skin get used to it, but after a month there is no change. I regret getting cheaper model, once the foils go bad I will switch to a different brand.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Best Electric Razor I've Ever Owned
customer_reviews.text: I am a bit obsessive compulsive when it comes to getting rid of unwanted hair, and this electric razor is so far the easiest and most comfortable to use of the bunch I've tried. It is, however, the most expensive one I've bought/used so far. I have the option of using it anywhere anytime even in the shower, and it provides a reasonably touch-ready shave in just 10 minutes without much effort; better if I spend more time and effort to detail. I've only had it for a month at the time of this review and it's still proving its quality.
customer_reviews.author: Miller

customer_reviews.title: Dulls quick with heavy use
customer_reviews.text: I shave my face and head. Though I'd try electric because I haven't had one in 14 years, and thought they might have improved. This thing got a couple weeks of shaves before it got so dull it was slower thany trusty DE razor, and tons of razor burn to go with the repetitions. If you shave a lot and got thick hair, I wouldn't recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon Gentry

customer_reviews.title: Great Shaver!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my bf. He's 51 never used an electric shaver has a beard growth rate that benefits with an early evening shave before going out or whatever. When he used a razor to do this second shave in the past he would possibly get some irritation which is completely removed with this shaver. He loves it and that he can use in the shower. He plans on getting one for his son.
customer_reviews.author: D.C.M.

customer_reviews.title: Dont waste your money
customer_reviews.text: I was very disapointed when i received this razor today. I charged it and tryed it out. At first i tryed it without shave cream. The dam thing didnt even cut. I then tryed it wet and with shave cream. Terrible. Im suprised at how bad this thing is. Please dont waste your money. I realize this isnt the best shaver that Braun sells But i certainly expected it to be better then it was. beware.
customer_reviews.author: david

customer_reviews.title: Meets my expectations.
customer_reviews.text: I've always used regular razors to shave and i still do, but I wanted something that will do body hair trimming and give a quick shave when time is against me. I saw this model and decided to give it a try. I really like it. Price point was good. It feels sturdy in my hand. Has a great surface to hold on to wet or dry. The trimmer that slides up is super and effective giving a close trim on body hair. I am not an expert on electric razors but I'm very happy with my new shaver. It was a good investment and i hope it lasts for several years. Time will tell!
customer_reviews.author: jeffrey

customer_reviews.title: Worked well until it didn't . . .
customer_reviews.text: Mine lasted 36 days before, when plugging it in, I heard a "POP" sound and now it won't charge anymore. Before that event it was a decent shaver. I have a lot of ingrown hairs and it was able to overcome most of them. Not sure if I will buy another.
customer_reviews.author: Gnik N.

customer_reviews.title: Works on my son... when he uses it.
customer_reviews.text: Bought for my sons awkward facial hair stage. At first I thought it wasn't working well. Turns out that since we can't pry him from video games enough that it works great... he just doesn't use it often enough.
customer_reviews.author: nowufny2

customer_reviews.title: Worked well while it lasted(1mo), be carful charging, apparently you can overcharge the razor.
customer_reviews.text: I used the razor for several weeks and it worked great. But then one weekend I left the razor on the charger for the whole weekend(accidentally). After that the lights on the front of the razor would continually flash and the razor would not power on. Sometimes when you hit the button to turn on the razor, it will buzz for half a second but will not continue to run. I think I may have overcharged the batteries. What I don't understand is why not include a charger that cuts off when the razor is fully charged. Seems like a big miss on Braun's part
customer_reviews.author: Robert Gniazdowski

customer_reviews.title: What an improvement!
customer_reviews.text: I had been using a Braun Series 1 razor for years and thought I loved it so much, why change. It finally quite working after many, many years of close shaves. In my search for a new razor, I read many razor reviews and felt I should share what many other reviewers also posted about the Series 3. I was amazed during the first time I used it by the faster speed of which I can now shave, along with the closer, smother shave it provides. Less time getting ready in the morning and a smooth, comfortable shave. It is, by far, the best razor I have ever owned!
customer_reviews.author: chadl

customer_reviews.title: If shaving was torture....
customer_reviews.text: Some people swear by this thing, others hate it. This shaver pulled and pinched and didn't even catch all the hair. I had to pull out a razor just to get what it missed. I tried it with shave gel and it cut my chin up so much, I had scabs for a couple days. Wouldn't recommend to anyone, except my worst enemy.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony

customer_reviews.title: Pass this one up and keep shopping
customer_reviews.text: The 2 two star review is officially stated as "I don't like it" and that's exactly how I feel. I am disappointed in the lack of hair it picks up. I wind up having to go over and over my face, way to many too times, to get some. I actually have to use a wet razor (hoped to never need them again) to fully shave. I had a 3-head Norelco before this and I definitely miss it. I would pass on this product.
customer_reviews.author: pdxkmk

customer_reviews.title: Awesome electric razor!
customer_reviews.text: I broke the first one being too rough with it while cleaning it. Very close shave when using a shaving product like Lectric Shave. Of course, you will break the screen if you press down hard on a jaw bone, so don't do it!
customer_reviews.author: William Lonergan

customer_reviews.title: Good enough
customer_reviews.text: I’m pregnant and bought this to shave my legs.... definitely not as good as I hoped. I have to go over certain spots a few times and try different directions. Not great but works well enough I guess.
customer_reviews.author: Julie

customer_reviews.title: Trimmer is pretty terrible
customer_reviews.text: I use the trimmer on my beard (which is not long) to keep a scruffy look when I don't want to be completely clean shaven, and it takes multiple multiple passes to catch the hair. I did not have this issue with my previous rechargeable, and it's very frustrating to use and see not-uniform length hairs on your chin/neck and have to constantly go over the same spots.
customer_reviews.author: michaeljjt

customer_reviews.title: Charger broke in less than two months, can't get another
customer_reviews.text: I had this for less than two months and the charger completely stopped working. I can't find any replacement chargers online and their customer service on their website is extremely difficult to find. Even if you do call you're on hold for over an hour, I finally gave up. The shaver is great but if you every need to order a replacement part or contact them for any work then you are SOL. I do NOT recommend this electric shaver or brand.
customer_reviews.author: TheAmazonShopper

customer_reviews.title: Shorted out after only one month
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my 16 year old son a month ago. He really liked the job that it did, but the last time he went to plug it in, the unit sparked and did not show any signs of life after that. It's completely dead and does not work so on that front, it was not a good buy as I will now have to buy something else to replace it.
customer_reviews.author: keller

product_meta.title: Braun Electric Razor for Men, Series 3 3040s Electric Shaver with Precision Trimmer, Rechargeable, Wet & Dry Foil Shaver
product_meta.description: Style Name:3040sBraun Series 3 shavers. Close shave, perfect skin comfort. With new MicroComb technology the Series 3 electric shaver catches and feeds more hair into the cutting parts, for a faster shave than ever before. Thanks to its triple action cutting system and SensoFoil the Series 3 electric razor not only delivers even better shaving performance on 3-day beards, but is also incredibly smooth on skin. Plus this Wet & Dry 3040 model can even be used in the shower with foam or gel for a more comfortable shaving experience*. The ergonomic grip with iconic Braun rubber dot pattern provides secure handling, even in wet bathroom conditions or when you rinse your shaver under running water. The Smart Plug comes with automatic 100-240 voltage adjustment, so you can use your Braun shaver worldwide when travelling *tested vs. previous Series 3 generation.
feature_bullets: 3 pressure-sensitive shaving elements for efficiency and skin comfort
Specialized micro comb captures more hair in each stroke* versus Braun Series 3. Tested on 3 day beard
Wet&dry shaver for use with water, foam or gel
Durable cordless electric shaver, waterproof to -5 meters

specifications.Domestic Shipping: Currently, item can be shipped only within the U.S. and to APO/FPO addresses. For APO/FPO shipments, please check with the manufacturer regarding warranty and support issues.
specifications.International Shipping: This item can be shipped to select countries outside of the U.S.
specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
